intro: Catimbium assimile, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which are typically trumpet-shaped and attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other hibiscus species and cotton. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in a fine pubescence. Catimbium assimile thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude cloud forests.
